captions.text:
Man: ALL RIGHT, HERE WE GO.
TAKE 2. ROLLING.

Woman:
THREE, TWO, ONE.

WE HAVE A BOXING SUPERSTAR
IN THE HOUSE.

FORMER WBA AND WBC SUPER
WELTERWEIGHT WORLD CHAMPION
CANELO ALVAREZ.

YOU'RE 23.
YOU'VE TAKEN ON SEVERAL TITLES.

A LOT OF CONFIDENCE
GOING INTO THAT FIGHT.
[ CHEERS AND APPLAUSE ]

Announcer:
FIGHTING AS A PROFESSIONAL
SINCE THE AGE OF 15,
HE DEMANDED THIS BOUT TONIGHT.

Narrator:
HE'S AMONG THE VERY FEW --

FIGHTERS WHO TRANSCEND
THE BOUNDARIES
OF SPORT AND COMMERCE.
BUT THE DIFFERENCE IS, AT 23,

CANELO'S LEGACY
IS STILL FORMATIVE...
...HIS PRIME JUST BEGUN.

WITH IT,
A VOW TO TAKE ON THE BEST,

EVEN A MAN NOBODY ELSE
WANTS TO FIGHT.

Announcer:
LARA CONTINUES TO TEE OFF.
Announcer: WOW!

Narrator: ...FEARED, AVOIDED,
AND CURIOUSLY CONTRADICTORY.

A PRODUCT OF CUBA'S
COMMUNIST MACHINE,

BUT HE CALLS HIMSELF
"THE AMERICAN DREAM."

Announcer:
TROUT IS STAGGERED AND DROPPED.

Narrator: LARA BAITED CANELO
INTO THIS BOUT,

KNOWING THAT THOSE SPECIAL FEW,
THE GREAT ONES IN THEIR PRIME,
MUST ACCEPT ANY CHALLENGE...
...RISK BE DAMNED.
[ INDISTINCT CONVERSATIONS ]

Man: PLEASE GIVE A BIG HAND
FOR THE SUPERSTAR FROM MEXICO,
SAúL CANELO ALVAREZ.

GREAT, GREAT, GREAT,
GREAT PERFORMANCE --

NOT JUST THE WIN,
BUT THE STATEMENT.

CANELO'S
NEVER BEEN GONE.

Narrator: IT'S SAID
THAT STYLES MAKE FIGHTS.

BUT SOMETIMES IT'S UP TO
THE FIGHTERS THEMSELVES.

CANELO'S MOMENT OF TRIUMPH
BECAME AN ACT OF PROVOCATION.

LET'S GO SAY HI
TO CANELO.

Narrator: SO IT BEGINS,
A WHIRLWIND PROMOTIONAL TOUR

THAT WILL TAKE THE FIGHTERS FROM
L.A. TO SAN JUAN IN FIVE DAYS.

IT'S GOOD BUSINESS TO PICK
A FIGHT WITH CANELO ALVAREZ.

ERISLANDY LARA'S
ARTFUL AGITATIONS

HAVE LANDED HIM THE BIGGEST BOUT
OF HIS CAREER.

♪ WHEN I TALK,
YOU SHOULD LISTEN ♪

♪ YOU DON'T TALK,
YOU DON'T SAY NOTHING, OKAY? ♪

♪ YOU DON'T TALK,
YOU DON'T SAY NOTHING, OKAY? ♪

DeCubas:
SOMETIMES WHEN YOU'RE LAID-BACK,
PEOPLE TEND TO OVERLOOK YOU.

THEY WANT TO ACT LIKE YOU'RE NOT
IN THE ROOM, YOU KNOW,

BUT THERE'S AN ELEPHANT
IN THE ROOM,

AND HE NEEDS TO
MAKE THAT BE KNOWN.
CANELO, HE WANTED TO FIGHT

BECAUSE OF THE PRESSURE
LARA PUT ON HIM.
HE DIDN'T WANT THIS FIGHT.

LIKE HE SAYS,
THE FANS WANTED IT.
AND THAT'S WHY WE'RE HERE.

Man: HOW YOU FEELING, MAN?
HOW YOU FEELING?

Narrator: A SOUTHPAW,
LARA IS WIDELY CONSIDERED

THE MOST DANGEROUS
AND TALENTED CHALLENGER
IN THE 154-POUND WEIGHT CLASS.

CANELO'S DECISION DIDN'T
SIT WELL WITH HIS PROMOTER,
OSCAR DE LA HOYA.

De La Hoya:
I DIDN'T LIKE THIS FIGHT.

I DIDN'T LIKE THIS FIGHT.
IT'S A DANGEROUS FIGHT.

IT'S NOT THE PRESSURE
FROM THE FANS OR LARA

BECAUSE HE WAS, YOU KNOW,
TAUNTING HIM.

NO, IT'S 'CAUSE HE JUST WANTS
TO FIGHT THE BEST.
I WANT TO FIGHT LARA.
"I WANT TO FIGHT LARA."

Narrator: IF LARA RESORTED
TO EXTREME MEASURES

IN SECURING HIS FIRST
PAY-PER-VIEW DATE,
HE HAD GOOD REASON.
HEY!
AT 31, HE HAS FOUR CHILDREN --

TWO BACK IN CUBA,
TWO IN THE STATES.

AND HIS WIFE, YUDI,
IS EXPECTING A FIFTH

JUST DAYS AFTER
THE CANELO FIGHT.
Man: LARA! WHOO!

Woman:
LARA, LARA, LARA.

THE CRUSH OF FANS, THE SEA
OF MICROPHONES AND CAMERAS,

LARA ISN'T ACCUSTOMED
TO THIS KIND OF ATTENTION.

BUT YUDI AND THEIR YOUNGEST SON,
LANDY YANIELL,

ARE HERE TO SEE HIM THROUGH
THIS STRANGE NEW WORLD --
THE PRE-FIGHT MEDIA BLITZ.

BY NOW, PAY-PER-VIEW OBLIGATIONS
ARE ROUTINE FOR CANELO.

WHAT'S NEW IS THE SENSE
THAT THIS ONE, THIS TIME,
IS PERSONAL.
[ REYNOSO SINGING IN SPANISH ]

Narrator:
REYNOSO ACADEMY OF BOXING,
ALSO KNOWN AS TRAINING CAMP,

CONVENES AT CANELO'S HOME
JUST OUTSIDE SAN DIEGO,

WHERE IT WILL REMAIN IN SESSION
FOR THE NEXT SIX WEEKS.
CHEPO REYNOSO AND HIS SON EDDY

HAVE BEEN WORKING WITH CANELO
SINCE HE WAS A KID.

THEY SAW HIM TURN PRO
AT THE AGE OF 15

AND REMAIN THE ONLY TRAINERS
HE'S EVER KNOWN.

IT'S BEEN 10 MONTHS
SINCE CANELO WAS DECISIONED
BY FLOYD MAYWEATHER.

HIS FIRST LOSS
INVIGORATED THE CRITICS,

WITH MANY SUGGESTING
THAT ALVAREZ WOULD BENEFIT
FROM A CHANGE IN TRAINERS,

A NOTION THE CHAMPION
HAS FLATLY REJECTED.

HIS CHOICE TO STAY WITH THE
REYNOSOS REMAINED HOTLY DEBATED
GOING INTO HIS MARCH 8th BOUT

AGAINST THE HEAVY-HANDED
ALFREDO ANGULO,

A FIGHTER WHO HAD
KNOCKED DOWN LARA TWICE.

Announcer: THE QUESTION IS, HOW
WILL CANELO BOUNCE BACK TONIGHT?
[ MAN SPEAKING SPANISH ]
CANELO!
CANELO!

Announcer: CANELO ROCKING
THE HEAD WITH THE RIGHT HAND.

CANELO LOOKS VERY MUCH
LIKE THE FIGHTER
WHO WAS ON THAT TERRIFIC RISE

BEFORE RUNNING INTO
THE POUND-FOR-POUND KING
LAST SEPTEMBER.
THERE'S A LEAD LEFT UPPERCUT.

AND REFEREE
HAS STOPPED THIS FIGHT.
I'M SORRY.
[ CROWD CHEERING ]

Man: HE IS THE WINNER BY WAY
OF TECHNICAL KNOCKOUT,
SAúL CANELO ALVAREZ!

Narrator: THE VICTORY WAS SEEN
AS A FIRST STEP

TOWARDS RE-ESTABLISHING CANELO'S
IDENTITY AT 154 POUNDS

AND A VINDICATION
FOR HIS TRAINERS.
[ BOTH GRUNTING ]
[ SPEAKS SPANISH ]

Narrator:
HE'S A LONG WAY FROM HOME,

BUT ERISLANDY LARA'S BEEN
PUTTING DOWN ROOTS IN HOUSTON,

WHERE HIS TRAINING CAMP
HAS BEGUN.
IF HE'S NOT IN THE GYM,

HE'S HOME WITH HIS WIFE, KIDS,
AND HIS BIRDS.
COMING OF AGE IN CASTRO'S CUBA,

LARA CAME TO THINK
OF THE SPORT HE LOVED

AS A METAPHOR
FOR THE STATE ITSELF --

RIGID, STIFLING,
AND ULTIMATELY OPPRESSIVE.
[ MAN SPEAKS SPANISH ]
[ BOYS CHANTING IN SPANISH ]

Narrator: AT THE 2007
PAN AMERICAN GAMES,

LARA AND GUILLERMO RIGONDEAUX,
BOTH AMATEUR CHAMPIONS,
ABANDONED THEIR TEAM IN BRAZIL.

THEIR ATTEMPTED DEFECTION
WAS UNSUCCESSFUL,

AND THEY WERE DROPPED
FROM CUBA'S NATIONAL TEAM.

Shields:
THEY REALLY LOST EVERYTHING

BECAUSE THEY GOT THROWN OFF
THE NATIONAL TEAM.

YOU KNOW,
THEY WAS REALLY OSTRACIZED
FOR DOING WHAT THEY DID.

SO THEY REALLY DIDN'T
HAVE ANOTHER CHOICE
BUT TO TRY TO DEFECT AGAIN.
[ GRUNTING ]
[ WHISTLE BLOWS ]
AH!

EASY DAY.
EASY DAY.
NO.

IS THIS WHERE
THE CHAMP TRAINS?
CONGRATULATIONS.

HOW'S THE CHAMP?
EVERYTHING GOOD?
BEAUTIFUL.

Narrator: TODAY, CAMP CANELO
RECEIVES A SPECIAL VISITOR.

GOLDEN BOY FOUNDER
OSCAR DE LA HOYA

IS CHECKING ON HIS COMPANY'S
MOST PRECIOUS ASSET.

BUT FIRST, THERE'S ANOTHER SPORT
CLOSE TO EVERYONE'S HEART --
WORLD CUP SOCCER.

De La Hoya: MY RELATIONSHIP WITH
CANELO IS A GREAT FRIENDSHIP,

YOU KNOW,
A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP.

IT'S JUST, YOU KNOW,
HAVING RESPECT FOR EACH OTHER.
YEAH!
[ ALL SHOUTING ]
[ SPEAKS SPANISH ]
BEAUTIFUL.

Narrator: THESE HAVE BEEN
TRYING TIMES FOR DE LA HOYA.
LAST SEPTEMBER,

JUST DAYS BEFORE THE
MAYWEATHER/CANELO MEGA-FIGHT,

HE CHECKED INTO A REHABILITATION
CENTER FOR SUBSTANCE ABUSE.

SIX MONTHS AFTER LEAVING
THE FACILITY,

HE'S STILL LEARNING TO FIGHT
A SNEAKY, TREACHEROUS OPPONENT
ONE DAY AT A TIME.

De La Hoya:
I WAS IN A DARK PLACE.

IT MAYBE HAD TO DO SOMETHING
WITH RETIREMENT

AND MAYBE NOT BEING PART
OF BOXING

AND FIGHTING INSIDE THE RING,
BEING DEPRESSED.
BUT IT TOOK ME TO DARK PLACES.

I WENT INTO REHAB TO FIX MY MIND
AND MY BODY, TOO,
BECAUSE IT WAS BROKEN.
IT WAS BROKEN.

SO NOW THAT I WENT
TO REHABILITATION

AND I GOT MY HEART GOING, MY
SOUL, MY BODY, MY MIND -- WOW.
I'M READY.

I'M READY TO TAKE THIS FIGHT ON
LIKE THERE'S NO TOMORROW.

Narrator:
CANELO'S SPARRING SESSIONS
MIGHT BE OFF LIMITS TO CAMERAS
BUT NEVER TO OSCAR DE LA HOYA.

HIS CONFIDENCE IN ALVAREZ
IS CLEAR.

BUT SO ARE THE CONCERNS
ABOUT LARA.

De La Hoya:
I LOVE WHAT I SEE.
WE KNOW HE'S STRONG.
BUT HE'S LOOKING FAST.

STRAIGHT RIGHTS.
THAT'S THE ONE THAT'S GONNA WIN.

De La Hoya:
THIS KID IS STRONG.
HE IS STRONG.

ALL I CAN THINK ABOUT
WHEN HE WAS SPARRING WAS,

"THIS IS A GUY WHO IS GONNA
BE CHAMPION FOR MANY YEARS."
[ GRUNTING ]
I HAVE NO DOUBT IN MY MIND

THAT WE'RE WATCHING SOMETHING
SPECIAL IN CANELO ALVAREZ.

BUT ERISLANDY LARA IS --
HE'S THE REAL DEAL.

SO THIS IS A FIGHT THAT'S
VERY DANGEROUS FOR BOTH,

BUT WE HAVE ALL THE CONFIDENCE
IN THE WORLD
AND WE'RE WITH CANELO 100%.
[ BUZZING ]

Man: EVERY TIME LARA COMES HERE,
HE GETS THE EXECUTIVE CUT.

IF YOU NOTICE, ALL HIS FIGHTS,
HE GETS A MOHAWK.
REPRESENTS THE WARRIOR.
[ LAUGHTER ]

Narrator:
FRIDAYS AT THE BARBERSHOP

MAKE FOR A COMFORTING ROUTINE
FOR LARA AND HIS TWO BOYS.

IT'S A CHANCE
FOR SOME TIME TOGETHER
BEFORE LARA HEADS TO VEGAS.

GOT TO BE QUICK
'CAUSE THEY MOVE. [ LAUGHS ]
[ LAUGHTER ]
WE'RE HOPING FOR A KNOCKOUT.
AFTER THE SIXTH ROUND.

THAT'S WHEN THE REAL MAN
COME OUT.
HEY.
[ SPEAKING SPANISH ]

Narrator: RONNIE SHIELDS
HAS BEEN WITH LARA
NEARLY FOUR YEARS.

WHEN IT COMES TO BOXING TALENT
AND THE POTENTIAL FOR GREATNESS,

THE RENOWNED TRAINER
KNOWS OF WHAT HE SPEAKS.

SOME OF THE PEOPLE I'VE TRAINED
HAVE BEEN EVANDER HOLYFIELD,
PERNELL WHITAKER, MIKE TYSON.
AND WHEN I SAW LARA, YOU KNOW,

I WAS REALLY IMPRESSED
BY WHAT I SAW.

PEOPLE DISREGARD LARA.
WHY, I DON'T KNOW.

YOU KNOW, WE'VE FOUGHT SOME
OF THE BEST GUYS IN THE WORLD.

YOU KNOW, WE BOTH HAVE
THIS COMMON OPPONENT
IN ANGULO AND TROUT.

AND I THINK LARA BEAT THEM
MORE DECISIVELY THAN CANELO DID.

WITH LARA,
HE WAS COMPLETELY DESTROYED.

YOU KNOW, I MEAN, THE FIGHT
WASN'T EVEN CLOSE AT ALL.
[ BELL DINGING ]

Narrator: A DANGEROUS TECHNICIAN
WHO DOMINATED MIGUEL COTTO,

TROUT THEN LOST
FOR THE FIRST TIME TO CANELO.

STILL, HE WAS CONSIDERED
A FAVORITE
AGAINST LARA LAST DECEMBER.
LARA UNDERSTOOD THE END GAME.
IT WASN'T JUST BEATING TROUT.

HE HAD TO DO IT
MORE CONVINCINGLY THAN CANELO.
[ SPEAKS SPANISH ]

Announcer:
LARA PICKING ON TROUT.
THERE'S THE ONE-TWO COMBINATION.

Shields: HE BROKE TROUT DOWN.
IT WAS A MASTERY, HOW HE DID IT.
BUT WHEN HE SITS DOWN,

OH, MY GOD,
IT'S LIKE MIKE TYSON HIT YOU.
AND PEOPLE MAY NOT BELIEVE THAT.
BUT JUST ASK AUSTIN TROUT.

Announcer:
TROUT IS STAGGERED AND DROPPED

FOR THE SECOND TIME
IN HIS CAREER.

ERISLANDY LARA PUT ON A CLINIC
HERE TONIGHT.

Man: THE INTERIM WBA SUPER
WELTERWEIGHT WORLD CHAMPION,
ERISLANDY LARA.
[ LARA LAUGHS ]
[ LAUGHS ]

Narrator: FOR LARA, IT'S BEEN
A LONG AND PERILOUS JOURNEY
FROM GUANTANAMO TO LAS VEGAS.

THEN AGAIN, AN AMERICAN DREAM
IS A RISKY ONE.

CANELO, FOR HIS PART,
KNOWS ALL ABOUT THE STAKES.

THIS WASN'T THE FIGHT
HIS HANDLERS WANTED.

IT WAS THE FIGHT
HE WOULDN'T REFUSE.

JUST 23 BUT ALREADY CONSUMED
WITH HIS LEGACY.

THE FIGHTERS DON'T CONSIDER
THE RISK SO MUCH AS THE REWARD.

FOR THE CUBAN,
IT'S MANIFEST DESTINY.
FOR YOUNG CANELO, POSTERITY.

Shields: WHEN CANELO LOSES THIS
FIGHT, HE'S GONNA LOOK AT THEM,

"WHY DIDN'T YOU
TALK ME OUT OF IT?"

Narrator: TWO MEN BOUND
BY HONOR, SEEKING GLORY.
THEY MEET JULY 12th.

NOT PRINCIPLE AND ASPIRATION,
BUT FLESH AND BLOOD.

-- Captions by VITAC --
 www.vitac.com

ON THE NEXT "ALL ACCESS:
CANELO vs. LARA"...

Shields:
CANELO IS A STUBBORN GUY.
BUT ONCE WE BREAK HIM DOWN,

WE'RE GONNA SAY -- YOU KNOW,
WE'RE GONNA SCHOOL HIM.

WE'RE GONNA TAKE HIM
TO CUBAN SCHOOL.

Narrator: "ALL ACCESS" EPISODE 2
PREMIERES WEDNESDAY, JULY 9th.

DON'T MISS CANELO vs. LARA
SATURDAY JULY 12th
LIVE ON SHOWTIME PAY-PER-VIEW.

comments.author: TheScrewstone13

comments.text:
Canelo has never looked like an amateur against anyone :0 His trainers just 
had the wrong game plan for Mayweather but Canelo did as he was instructed 
to do. And Canelo totally won against Lara the only reason you believe Lara 
won is because the showtime commentators where completely one-sided in the 
fight. They kept highlighting any punch Lara would throw (even though some 
rounds Lara didn't seem to throw any). And so what, Canelo lost against 
Mayweather, every other great boxer in this day in age has. Canelo is only 
23 and  has a history of fighting the toughest fighters that no one else 
wants to. I don't think you can compare different boxing era's. I think 
it's like comparing Larry Bird and Kobe Bryant. Your not going to get 
anywhere.﻿

comments.author: Richard Torres

comments.text:
After seeing the fight twice I think it was a close fight, but I gave 
Canelo the win by 2 rounds. I feel Canelo landed the more effective 
combinations and power shots which made a huge difference. Lara used a 
style of boxing that is very defensive, which didn't allow Canelo to 
engaged like he wanted to. But as much movement as there is in that style, 
there has to be more punches. Lara had many opportunities to counter but 
instead he pushed himself away from the fight. I think if he would have 
counterpunched more and threw more combinations that would have really 
impressed the judges. When you fight a guy like Canelo I think you have to 
show the judges you can really outbox him. Perfect example, Mayweather, 
stayed in the pocket, threw combinations, backed Canelo up, counter punched 
him, which Lara did neither of those. They're really wasn't anything 
impressive about Lara besides his left hand and his jab. If he would have 
commit to his attack a bit more, he would have won the fight.﻿

comments.author: Yasel Campos

comments.text:
Canelo great fighter, it's just a shame lara was so unwilling to engage. 
Canelo tried to walk him down the entire fight. But when a guy is unwilling 
to fight, what can you do?
Sure lara got a few great counters and straight lefts in. But that's it.
Canelo got some great bodyshots in that you could tell hurt lara, even if 
he did deny it. By the end though, neither fighter seemed particularly 
worse off.
Didn't really have a problem with this going either way. Canelo didn't put 
on his best performance ever, and lara ran. (what mayweather fans will call 
'schooled canelo')

117-111 by that mexican judge is just disgusting. He should never be 
allowed to judge again. Depending on what you think scores points, this 
could have went either way by one or two rounds﻿

comments.text:
Lara was doing good early as he was boxing and throwing his straight 
punches, he was making canelo miss but the mistake that he made was not 
making canelo pay after he misses... He gave canelo confidence and 
eventually he stopped moving his hands on the inside which looked bad for 
the judges, especially Canelo being as powerful as he is remember he got a 
Draw against Mayweather from one judge in a fight he probably only won 2-3 
rounds...  I think that Lara will look at the fight and see the mistake he 
made, I think the fight was really close and I think Canelo did enough to 
win but not enough to say that he's BETTER then Lara because right after 
Canelo basically said Fuck no to a rematch... Because, Lara basically let 
the fight slip away, it wasn't Canelo who imposed himself and won the fight 
with his skills it was because Lara stopped throwing and mentally I know 
Canelo didn't feel like the winner because he was getting out boxed early 
on and edged out a decision only because Lara made a mistake. ﻿

comments.author: oscar vazquez

comments.text:
En mi opinion, Lara gano la pelea. SU estilo es muy parecido al de 
Mayweather, pero Lara no es nadie reconocido hasta ahora y eso hace una 
gran diferencia en el boxeo aqui. Lara no corre, es simplemente ser 
inteligente, dar y que no te den. El boxeo ha cambiado ultimamente y eso es 
lo que muchas personas no entienden. El canelo se sorprendio de haber 
ganada, se preguntan porque. Si ven los resultados de los golpes efectivos 
encontraran la respuesta. Lara uso la misma tecnica que Mayweather para 
frustar a Canelo y lo logro en los primeros as altos. Mis repetos para Lara 
y espero que aprenda como funciona el boxeo aqui. Cuando tengas un nombre, 
no te quitan la pelea como lo hicieron anoche. NO SOY CUBANA!﻿
comments.author: Jane D

comments.text:
In my opinion, Lara won the match. He has the same style as Mayweather, but 
he doesn't have a name and that in boxing makes a huge difference. What 
Lara does is not running. He is just being smart, is the art of hitting and 
not getting hit. Boxing has changed over time and that is what some people 
don't understand. Even Canelo was surprised that he won, he was confused 
with the decision, wonder why? If you look at the results of the punches, 
who won?  Lara, more effective punches. Lara used the same technique 
Mayweather used to frustrate Canelo, but he did it on the first rounds. My 
respects for Lara, I hope you learn how boxing works here. Get a name and 
you will be BIG. I AM NOT CUBAN!﻿
